IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: GUIDED BY CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES, WE SERVE AND EMPOWER THOSE IN NEED.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GUIDED BY CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES, WE SERVE AND EMPOWER THOSE IN NEED.
IRS990.Desc: THE EDUCATIONAL ENRICHMENT PROGRAM (EEP) IS PROVIDED AFTER SCHOOL AND ALL DAY IN SUMMER TO LOW-INCOME STUDENTS IN INNER-CITY FORT WORTH. IN THIS PROGRAM, UCC PROVIDES THREE CRITICAL LITERACY PROGRAMS YEAR-ROUND: A FOUNDATIONAL PROGRAM FOR EMERGING READERS IN PRE-K AND K, CALLED I CAN READ!, AN INTERVENTION PROGRAM TO ADVANCE THE READING LEVELS OF HIGH-RISK PRIMARY GRADE STUDENTS SIGNIFICANTLY BELOW GRADE LEVEL CALLED LEVELED LITERACY INTERVENTION (LLI), AND OUR CORE EDUCATIONAL ENRICHMENT PROGRAM (EEP), A BALANCED LITERACY PROGRAM SUPPLEMENTING FORT WORTH INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT (FWISD) INSTRUCTION. OUR AT-RISK CHILDREN ATTEND LOW-PERFORMING SCHOOLS IN FWISD. ALL LITERACY PROGRAMS HELP OUR STUDENTS BECOME MORE PROFICIENT READERS. OUR SUMMER READING PROGRAMS NOT ONLY PREVENT THE "SUMMER SLIDE" BUT HELP MANY CHILDREN IN THE PROGRAM RETURN TO SCHOOL ON A HIGHER READING LEVEL. IN THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED, MARCH 31, 2023, UCC PROVIDED LITERACY INSTRUCTION TO 375 STUDENTS. WHILE PARTICIPATING IN THE EEP PROGRAM, STUDENTS WERE PROVIDED OVER 98,456 MEALS AND SNACKS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE CLIENT ASSISTANCE AND ADVOCACY PROGRAM PROVIDES EMERGENCY FOOD AND CLOTHING, GED PREPARATION, COMPUTER SKILLS TRAINING, ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE, ASSISTANCE TO SENIORS, INFORMATION, AND REFERRALS. UCC IS A HOST AGENCY FOR SER'S SENIOR COMMUNITY SERVICE EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM (SCSEP). SCSEP IS A COMMUNITY SERVICE AND WORK BASED TRAINING PROGRAM FOR OLDER WORKERS. THROUGH THIS PARTNERSHIP UCC PROVIDES TRAINING TO SEVEN SENIORS WEEKLY TO UPDATE THEIR SKILLS. UCC ALSO PARTNERS WITH TRANSITIONAL WORK SOLUTIONS (TWS) TO HELP INJURED EMPLOYEES RETURN TO WORK BY MATCHING THEM WITH NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN NEED OF VOLUNTEERS AS THEY HEAL. UCC COLLABORATES WITH THE TARRANT AREA FOOD BANK TO HOST A MONTHLY MOBILE FOOD PANTRY AT THE WESLEY CENTER. UCC DISTRIBUTED ON AVERAGE 13,750 POUNDS OF FOOD MONTHLY TO ABOUT 250 FAMILIES THROUGH THE MOBILE FOOD PANTRY. DURING THE HOLIDAY SEASON, UCC DISTRIBUTED 600 THANKSGIVING MEALS TO CIENTS. THROUGHOUT THE 2023 FISCAL YEAR, UCC PROVIDED EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO 13,643 PEOPLE AND DISPENSED APPROXIMATELY 350,000 POUNDS OF FOOD AT THREE CENTERS. 83% OF THE CLIENTS SERVED THROUGH UCC HAVE AN ANNUAL FAMILY INCOME UNDER $24,400.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INT. IN ASSETS HELD IN UCC F
RIGHT OF USE ASSET OPERATING LEASE NET

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part IV, Line 2b: Explanation of escrow account liability
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UNITED COMMUNITY CENTERS PARTNERS WITH ADVANCE, A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, TO PROVIDE LOW-INCOME, AT-RISK CHILDREN WITH THE EARLY FOUNDATION NEEDED FROM BIRTH TO AGE 3 THAT PREPARES THEM FOR SUCCESS IN SCHOOL. WHILE CHILDREN RECEIVE SERVICES FROM UCC, ADVANCE WORKS WITH THE PARENTS IN ORDER TO REINFORCE THE FOUNDATIONAL SUPPORT PROVIDED BY UCC. UCC HAS RECEIVED A GRANT AND HOLDS THESE FUNDS UNTIL THEY ARE USED TO REIMBURSE ADVANCE FOR THE COST OF THEIR SERVICES.

The Organization is recognized by the IRS as exempt from federal income tax under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) and has not been classified as a private foundation as defined in the IRC. Income generated from activities unrelated to the Organizations exempt purposes is subject to tax under IRC Section 511. The Organization had no unrelated business income for the year ended March 31, 2023. Accordingly, no provision or liability has been reported.GAAP requires the evaluation of tax positions taken in the course of preparing the Organizations tax return and recognition of a tax liability (or asset) if the Organization has taken an uncertain position that more likely than not would not be sustained upon examination by the Internal Revenue Service. Management has analyzed the tax positions taken by the Organization and has concluded that as of March 31, 2023, there are no uncertain tax positions taken or expected to be taken that would require recognition of a liability (or asset) or disclosure in the financial statements.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: FIELD TRIP FUNDS FOR PROGRAM PARTIC

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: MEALS AND SNACKS SERVED AT CENTERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UCC MONITORS ITS NON-CASH ASSISTANCE PROGRAM THROUGH ITS APPLICATION PROCESS. APPLICANTS, INCLUDING, FAMILIES ENROLLING CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN THE SUMMER DAY CAMP PROGRAM AND INDIVIDUALS SEEKING ASSISTANCE WITH FOOD, CLOTHING, RESOURCE REFERRALS, AND HOLIDAY FOOD, MUST PROVIDE PROOF OF INCOME AND RESIDENCY, AS WELL AS, MEET THE POVERTY GUIDELINES. DEMOGRAPHIC AND ASSISTANCE INFORMATION IS ENTERED INTO A DATABASE THAT PROVIDES RECORDS AND REPORTS TO TRACK AND MONITOR THE USE OF FUNDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MR. MICHAEL MALLOY AND MS. COURTNEY MCKAY HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON COMPLETION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990, EACH BOARD MEMBER RECEIVES A COPY FOR REVIEW. ANY BOARD MEMBER CAN ASK QUESTIONS AND MAKE SUGGESTIONS REGARDING THE TAX RETURN PRIOR TO THE OFFICIAL BOARD MEETING WHERE FINAL APPROVAL IS OBTAINED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS MET THROUGH A PROCESS OF SELF-DISCLOSURE BY A BOARD DIRECTOR ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE CURRENT POLICY STATES THAT THE BOARD DIRECTOR SHALL ANNUALLY COMPLETE A DISCLOSURE FORM IDENTIFYING ANY RELATIONSHIPS, POSITIONS, OR CIRCUMSTANCES IN WHICH THEY ARE INVOLVED OR THAT THEY BELIEVE COULD CONTRIBUTE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS THROUGH THEIR ANNUAL BUDGET PROCESS AND IMPLEMENTED BY THE PRESIDENT AND CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VIII INCOME FROM FUNDRAISING EVENTS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: the net economic benefit from our fundraising events is calculated as follows:Contributions from fundraising events reported on Part VIII, line 1c $ 38,223Gross income from fundraising events reported on Part VIII, line 8a 14,777Less: Direct costs of events reported on part VIII, Line 8b (22,335) Net economic benefit of fundraising events $ 30,665
